intro: Neanotis quadrilocularis, commonly known as the four-chambered bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its unique bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms, aiding in its nutrient acquisition. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its leaves are usually submerged, while its flowering stems emerge above the water surface. Neanotis quadrilocularis is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling.
